intro: Homalium planiflorum, commonly known as the flat-flowered hooligan. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, native to tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
